summary: This document is an email chain from February 2021 between FBI personnel and a paralegal from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC, discussing a request for reimbursement of therapy costs for a Florida-based victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The victim lacks health insurance and has paid for treatment out-of-pocket, and the paralegal is inquiring about previously offered FBI victim services.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.role: Florida Registered Paralegal at Edwards Pottinger LLC
persons.context: She is the primary correspondent, advocating on behalf of an unnamed Epstein victim to seek reimbursement from the FBI's Victim Services Division for therapy costs the victim has paid out-of-pocket.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: He is copied on all emails in the chain, indicating he is the supervising attorney for the case involving the victim seeking reimbursement.

persons.name: Maria Cardenal
persons.role: Unknown role at Edwards Pottinger LLC
persons.context: She is copied on the emails, suggesting she is part of the legal team at Edwards Pottinger LLC working on the victim's case.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.role: Unknown role at Edwards Pottinger LLC
persons.context: She is copied on the emails, suggesting she is part of the legal team at Edwards Pottinger LLC working on the victim's case.

persons.name: Shelley Kavanagh
persons.role: Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) at Oakbrook Counseling Center
persons.context: She is identified as the therapist providing treatment to the unnamed Epstein victim at the Oakbrook Counseling Center in Tamarac, Florida.

connections.description: Kelljchian is a paralegal at the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC, where Edwards is an attorney; she is corresponding on behalf of a client and copying him.
Kelljchian is acting as a legal representative, seeking reimbursement for therapy costs on behalf of the victim.
As the attorney copied on all correspondence, Edwards is presumably the lead counsel representing the victim.
Kavanagh is the therapist providing counseling services to the victim.

events.title: Initial Reimbursement Inquiry
events.description: Maria Kelljchian first emails the FBI inquiring about reimbursement for therapy paid for by an Epstein victim, providing therapist details and invoices.

events.title: Follow-up on Victim Services
events.description: Email chain continues with Kelljchian following up on the reimbursement request, referencing prior FBI offers of therapy sessions for uninsured victims.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301 (Edwards Pottinger LLC office)
4804 W. Commercial Blvd., Tamarac, FL 33319 (Oakbrook Counseling Center)
keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division (VSD) had previously offered therapy sessions (specifically 12 sessions) to Florida-based Epstein victims who lacked health insurance.
An unnamed Epstein victim in Florida, represented by the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC, has been paying for therapy out-of-pocket and is seeking reimbursement from the FBI.
There is confusion or a procedural issue, as an FBI agent responds that they "don't reimburse" and notes that approval from VSD was required prior to any treatment.
The therapy was provided by Shelley Kavanagh, LCSW, at the Oakbrook Counseling Center in Tamarac, Florida.
The correspondence highlights ongoing efforts by victims' legal representatives to secure financial support for mental health treatment related to the Epstein case.
